Trial_Design.evidence: randomly allocated to the probe-based NIRAF or control group

Participants.evidence: Patients undergoing parathyroidectomy for primary hyperparathyroidism were prospectively enrolled

Intervention.evidence: randomly allocated to the probe-based NIRAF or control group

Objective.evidence: To evaluate the benefits of probe-based near infrared autofluorescence (NIRAF) parathyroid identification during parathyroidectomy.

Method_Outcome.evidence: number of parathyroids identified with high confidence by the surgeon and the resident

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomly allocated to the probe-based NIRAF or control group

Number_Randomised.evidence: One hundred and sixty patients were randomly enrolled under both surgeons to the probe group (n=80) vs. control (n=80).

Result_Outcome.evidence: parathyroid identification rate of the senior surgeon improved significantly from 3.2 to 3.6 parathyroids per patient (p<0.001)
